meanings.definition: To be a perfect example of something.
meanings.sent1: The hardworking student epitomised dedication by studying every night.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness and generosity epitomised the spirit of the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown epitomised gracefulness when he accidentally did a perfect pirouette.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree epitomised strength as it withstood the fierce storm.
meanings.sent5: The bright smile on her face epitomised happiness and joy to everyone around her.

meanings.definition: To embody the essential characteristics of something.
meanings.sent1: The painting epitomised beauty with its vibrant colors and intricate details.
meanings.sent2: His actions epitomised courage as he stood up for what he believed in.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy epitomised laziness by napping all day long.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song epitomised sadness, bringing tears to everyone's eyes.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread epitomised comfort and warmth on a cold winter day.
